question: In the 18th century, the capital of Russia was moved from Moscow to where?
chain_of_thought_result: In the 18th century, the capital of Russia was moved from Moscow to St. Petersburg. This change was initiated by Tsar Peter the Great, who founded St. Petersburg in 1703 and made it the capital in 1712. The city remained the capital until 1918, when the capital was moved back to Moscow.
